poem_title: THE Universal Hallelujah, OR, PSALM 148. PARAPHRAS'D.
author: Isaac Watts

lines.line_text: PRAISE ye the Lord each Heavenly Tongue
That sits around his Throne:
the Man shall lead the Song,
The God inspire the Tune.

stanzas.stanza_text:
PRAISE ye the Lord each Heavenly Tongue
That sits around his Throne:
the Man shall lead the Song,
The God inspire the Tune.

lines.line_text: and all th' Immortal Quire
That fill the Realms above,
Sing, for the form'd you of his Fire,
And feeds you with his Love.

stanzas.stanza_text:
and all th' Immortal Quire
That fill the Realms above,
Sing, for the form'd you of his Fire,
And feeds you with his Love.

lines.line_text: Shine to his Praise ye Chrystal Skies,
The Floor of his Abode,
Or vail your little twinkling Eyes
Before a brighter God.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Shine to his Praise ye Chrystal Skies,
The Floor of his Abode,
Or vail your little twinkling Eyes
Before a brighter God.

lines.line_text: Thou rolling Globe of Golden Light
Whose Beams Create our Days,
Joyn with the Silver Queen of Night
To own your borrow'd Rays.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Thou rolling Globe of Golden Light
Whose Beams Create our Days,
Joyn with the Silver Queen of Night
To own your borrow'd Rays.

lines.line_text: Blush and refund the Honours paid
To your inferiour Names;
Tell the blind World, your Orbs are fed
By his O'reflowing Flames.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Blush and refund the Honours paid
To your inferiour Names;
Tell the blind World, your Orbs are fed
By his O'reflowing Flames.

lines.line_text: Winds, ye shall bear his Name aloud
Thro' the Ethereal Blue,
For when His Chariot is a Cloud
He makes his Wheels of you.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Winds, ye shall bear his Name aloud
Thro' the Ethereal Blue,
For when His Chariot is a Cloud
He makes his Wheels of you.

lines.line_text: Thunder and Hail, and Fires and Storms,
The Troops of his Command,
Appear in all your Dreadful Forms,
And speak his awful Hand.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Thunder and Hail, and Fires and Storms,
The Troops of his Command,
Appear in all your Dreadful Forms,
And speak his awful Hand.

lines.line_text: Shout to the Lord, ye Surging Seas,
In your Eternal Roar,
Let Wave to Wave resound his Praise,
And Shore reply to Shore:

stanzas.stanza_text:
Shout to the Lord, ye Surging Seas,
In your Eternal Roar,
Let Wave to Wave resound his Praise,
And Shore reply to Shore:

lines.line_text: While Monsters rolling on the Flood
In Scaly Silver shine,
Speak terribly their Maker-God,
And lash the foaming Brine.

stanzas.stanza_text:
While Monsters rolling on the Flood
In Scaly Silver shine,
Speak terribly their Maker-God,
And lash the foaming Brine.

lines.line_text: But Gentler Things shall tune his Name
To softer Notes than these,
Young  breathing o're the Stream,
Or whispering thro' the Trees.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But Gentler Things shall tune his Name
To softer Notes than these,
Young  breathing o're the Stream,
Or whispering thro' the Trees.

lines.line_text: Wave your tall Heads, ye lofty Pines,
To him that bid you grow,
Sweet Clusters, bend the fruitful Vines
On every Thankful Bough.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Wave your tall Heads, ye lofty Pines,
To him that bid you grow,
Sweet Clusters, bend the fruitful Vines
On every Thankful Bough.

lines.line_text: Let the shrill Birds his Honour raise,
And tune it in the Sky:
While groveling Beasts attempt his Praise
With hoarser Harmony.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Let the shrill Birds his Honour raise,
And tune it in the Sky:
While groveling Beasts attempt his Praise
With hoarser Harmony.

lines.line_text: Thus while the meaner Creatures sing,
Ye Mortals take the Sound,
Eccho the Glories of your King
Thro' all the Nations round.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Thus while the meaner Creatures sing,
Ye Mortals take the Sound,
Eccho the Glories of your King
Thro' all the Nations round.

lines.line_text: Th' Eternal Name must fly abroad
From  to ;
And the whole Race shall bow to God
That owns the Name of Man.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Th' Eternal Name must fly abroad
From  to ;
And the whole Race shall bow to God
That owns the Name of Man.
